title: The Monaco Job
description: A heist goes sideways on the Riviera.

scenes.title: The Setup
scenes.content:
Look, I know what you're thinking. Another casino heist story. But stick with me here. This one's different.

I'm crouched behind a potted palm in the Casino de Monte-Carlo, watching Dmitri "The Bear" Volkov lose fifty grand at baccarat. The man sweats like he's in a sauna. Perfect.

My earpiece crackles. "Phoenix, you in position?" That's Sophia. Real name Sarah Jenkins from Ohio, but she insists on the exotic alias. Can't blame her. Sarah Jenkins doesn't sound like someone who can crack a Mosler Double Guard.

"Copy that, Nightingale." See? I play along.

The plan's simple. Wait for Dmitri to hit the bar. Slip the tracker on his Patek Philippe when he's distracted. Follow him to tomorrow's yacht party where the real score waits. A Monet. Water Lilies number forty-seven. Twenty million, easy.

Dmitri stands. Stumbles a bit. The Bear's had quite a few vodkas.

Here we go.

choices.text: Follow Dmitri to the bar immediately
Wait and observe his bodyguards first

scenes.title: The Approach
scenes.content:
I slide through the crowd like butter on warm toast. Dmitri's already ordering at the bar. Beluga Gold Line vodka. Of course.

Two bodyguards flank him. Ivan and Sergei. Creative parents, those Russians. Ivan's busy checking his phone. Sergei's eyeing a brunette in a red dress.

Perfect timing.

I sidle up next to Dmitri. Order a martini. Bump into him just as he reaches for his drink.

"Pardon," I say in my best French accent. "Clumsy American tourist."

Dmitri grunts. Doesn't even look at me. His Patek Philippe gleams under the casino lights. The tracker's the size of a pinhead. Magnetic. Should stick right to the crown.

I reach out. Steady hands. Professional.

Then Dmitri's phone rings. He jerks his wrist away to answer it. My finger grazes the watch face instead.

"Da?" Dmitri barks into his phone. His face goes white. "What do you mean she's gone?"

choices.text: Try to plant the tracker while he's distracted by the call
Back away and abort the mission

scenes.title: The Wait
scenes.content:
Patience. That's what separates the pros from the prison inmates.

I study the bodyguards. Ivan keeps checking his Rolex. Nervous tic. Sergei's got a slight bulge under his left armpit. Sig Sauer P226, I'd guess. Both men scan the room every thirty seconds. Clockwork.

But here's the thing about patterns. They make you predictable.

Dmitri's phone buzzes. He answers with a growl. "Da?"

Then his face changes. The color drains out like someone pulled a plug. "What do you mean she's gone?"

Both bodyguards snap to attention. The brunette in the red dress forgotten. This is bigger than a social call.

Dmitri starts rapid-firing Russian. I catch a few words. My college language classes finally paying off. Something about a boat. A woman. And the phrase "before midnight."

Sergei whispers something to Ivan. Ivan nods and starts moving toward the exit.

Well. This just got interesting.

choices.text: Follow Ivan to see where he's going
Stay with Dmitri and try to plant the tracker

scenes.title: The Distraction
scenes.content:
"Nightingale, I need some razzle-dazzle at the bar."

"Copy that, Phoenix. Give me thirty seconds."

Sophia's good. Really good. She appears at the far end of the bar like smoke. Red dress that costs more than my car. She orders champagne and somehow manages to knock over three glasses while doing it.

Crash. Tinkle. The bartender scrambles for towels.

Dmitri turns to watch. So do both bodyguards. Can't blame them.

I make my move. Slip the tracker right onto his watch crown. Smooth as silk.

Then Dmitri's phone rings.

"Da?" His voice cuts through the bar noise. "What do you mean she's gone?"

His face goes pale. Not good pale. Bad pale. The kind that means someone's about to get shot.

Sophia catches my eye. She's thinking the same thing. This wasn't part of the plan.

Dmitri barks something in Russian to his men. They both reach inside their jackets.

choices.text: Signal Sophia to get out now
Stay close to Dmitri to learn more

scenes.title: The Chase
scenes.content:
Ivan moves fast for a big guy. I keep thirty feet back. Blend with the tourists. Just another sucker who lost at roulette.

He cuts through the casino floor. Past the high-roller tables. Out a service exit.

I follow him into Monaco's back alleys. Cobblestones. Narrow streets. The kind of place where screams get lost in the noise from the bars.

Ivan stops at a black Mercedes. Checks his phone. Makes a call.

I duck behind a dumpster. Classy, I know.

"The boat's ready," Ivan says. English now, with an accent thick as borscht. "Tell the boss we move her tonight. Before the auction."

Her? Auction?

Ivan hangs up. Gets in the car. Drives toward the harbor.

I'm standing in an alley that smells like fish and regret, realizing this job just became something else entirely.

My earpiece crackles. "Phoenix, where'd you go? Dmitri just left in a hurry."

"Change of plans, Nightingale. Meet me at Port Hercules. And bring the binoculars."

choices.text: Head to the harbor to investigate
This is too dangerous. Call it off.

scenes.title: The Team-Up
scenes.content:
"Nightingale, I need you over here. Something's wrong."

Sophia appears at my elbow thirty seconds later. She's good at that. Materializing.

"What's the situation?"

"Dmitri got a call. Someone's gone. His guys are panicking."

We watch Ivan push through the crowd toward the exit. Sergei stays glued to Dmitri, one hand inside his jacket.

"I'll take Ivan," Sophia says. "You stick with the Bear."

"Since when do you give orders?"

"Since you started looking like a confused tourist."

Fair point.

She's gone before I can argue. Slipping through the casino like a ghost in designer heels.

I turn back to Dmitri. He's already moving. Fast. Sergei clearing a path.

I follow at a distance. Out the main entrance. Down the marble steps. Into a waiting Bentley.

The car heads toward the harbor. I flag down a taxi.

"Follow that Bentley," I tell the driver.

He looks at me like I've lost my mind. "Monsieur, this is not a movie."

"Hundred euros says it is."

He follows the Bentley.

scenes.title: The Escape
scenes.content:
I give Sophia the abort signal. Two fingers across my throat. Subtle.

She doesn't hesitate. Tips her champagne glass onto the bar, gasps like she's mortified, and uses the commotion to slip toward the exit.

I'm right behind her. Walking. Not running. Running attracts attention.

We make it to the casino steps. Monaco glitters below us. Yachts in the harbor. Sports cars on the streets. All that money, and none of it ours tonight.

"What happened?" Sophia asks.

"Dmitri's into something bigger than art theft. Way bigger. Someone's missing. They're talking about moving 'her' before midnight."

"Her?"

"That's what I heard."

Sophia's quiet for a moment. "So what do we do?"

Good question. We came here to steal a painting. Not get tangled up in whatever this is.

But that word keeps echoing. Her.

Someone's in trouble. Real trouble.

choices.text: Walk away. This isn't our fight.

scenes.title: The Harbor
scenes.content:
"We need to get to our boat before they lock down the harbor."

Sophia's already moving. We cut through side streets. Past gelato shops and jewelry stores. The harbor's ten minutes away on foot.

Make that five if you're running.

We're running.

Port Hercules comes into view. Police boats already circling. Blue lights flashing across the water.

"There." Sophia points. Our speedboat's still at the dock. Untouched.

We sprint down the pier. I jump in first. Keys under the seat where we left them.

The engine roars to life.

"Stop! Arrêtez!"

Harbor patrol. Two officers running toward us. One's reaching for his radio.

Sophia casts off the lines. I gun the throttle.

We shoot out of the harbor like a cork from a champagne bottle. The patrol boats are too slow. Too far.

Five minutes later, we're in international waters. Monaco shrinking behind us.

"Well," Sophia says, catching her breath. "No Monet. No twenty million."

"But we're not in handcuffs."

"Small victories."

The Mediterranean stretches ahead. Dark and endless.

Sometimes getting away clean is the only win that matters.

scenes.title: The Revelation
scenes.content:
I lean closer. Pretend to study the wine list. Dmitri's still shouting into his phone.

"She was supposed to be on the yacht until tomorrow night. How does someone just disappear from a boat?"

Pause. His knuckles go white around the phone.

"Find her. Now. The auction starts in six hours."

Auction? What auction?

He hangs up. Turns to Sergei. "Call Monaco harbor. Lock down every boat. Nobody leaves."

My blood runs cold. That's not about some missing girlfriend. That's about our exit strategy. Our speedboat's sitting in that harbor.

Sergei pulls out his phone. Starts dialing.

I catch a glimpse of Sophia across the bar. She's watching me. Waiting for a signal. The tracker's planted but this whole job just went sideways.

Dmitri downs his vodka in one gulp. "Change of plans," he tells Ivan. "We move the package tonight. Before she can talk."

Package? Talk to who?

This isn't about a painting anymore.

choices.text: Follow Dmitri to find out about this 'package'
Warn Sophia and try to escape before the harbor lockdown

scenes.title: The Retreat
scenes.content:
Sometimes the smart play is knowing when you're beat.

I back away from the bar. Dmitri's still shouting into his phone. Something about boats and auctions and finding someone before midnight. His bodyguards look ready to start shooting.

This isn't our job anymore.

I find Sophia by the roulette table. She's betting on red. Always bets on red.

"We're done," I whisper.

"What? Why?"

"Whatever Dmitri's mixed up in, it's bigger than art theft. Way bigger."

She looks at me like I've lost my mind. "We've been planning this for six months."

"And we'll be planning our prison meals if we stay."

The roulette ball bounces. Lands on black. Sophia's chips disappear.

"See?" I say. "Bad omens everywhere."

She sighs. Picks up her purse. "You're the boss, Phoenix. But next time, I pick the target."

We walk toward the exit. Behind us, Dmitri's voice gets louder. More desperate.

Sometimes the house wins. Sometimes you walk away with your skin intact.

Tonight, that's victory enough.

scenes.title: The Discovery
scenes.content:
I shadow Dmitri through Monte-Carlo's winding streets. He's moving fast now. Scared fast.

We end up at Port Hercules. The yacht district. His boat's a monster. Ninety-footer called The Czarina. Very subtle.

Dmitri boards. I find a spot behind some shipping crates and watch.

That's when I see her. A woman being dragged up the gangplank by two men. She's fighting. Blonde hair. Expensive clothes torn.

Wait. I know that face. Seen it in newspapers.

Lady Catherine Whitmore. British art collector. She disappeared from London three weeks ago.

Holy hell. This isn't a heist. It's a kidnapping operation.

My earpiece crackles. "Phoenix, where are you? The harbor's crawling with police boats."

"Sophia, we've got a problem. Dmitri's not just an art dealer. He's trafficking people."

"What?"

"Lady Whitmore. She's alive. And she's on his yacht."

Silence on the radio.

Then: "So what's the play, boss?"

Good question. Call the cops and blow our cover? Or find another way?

choices.text: Board the yacht and attempt a rescue
Call an anonymous tip to Monaco police

scenes.title: The Hero
scenes.content:
Look, I'm not proud of what happened next. Heroes are for movies. But sometimes you can't walk away.

I swim out to The Czarina. Monaco's harbor water is cold as a banker's heart. The yacht's got two guards on deck. Both smoking. Both bored.

I climb up the anchor chain. Quiet as I can manage.

First guard goes down with a sleeper hold. Second one gets the same treatment before he can shout. They'll wake up with headaches and explanations to make.

I find Lady Whitmore in a cabin below deck. She's tied up but conscious.

"Who are you?" she whispers.

"Your ride home. Can you swim?"

"Not in these heels."

"Lose the shoes."

We make it to the deck. The harbor patrol boats are closing in. Dmitri must have called them off when he found his missing package.

Sophia's voice in my ear: "Phoenix, you've got company coming up the gangplank."

Footsteps. Heavy ones.

I look at Lady Whitmore. She looks at me. The water's twenty feet down.

"Trust me?" I ask.

"Do I have a choice?"

"Not really."

We jump.

scenes.title: The Tip
scenes.content:
I pull out my burner phone. Dial 17. French emergency services.

"Allo? J'ai des informations sur Lady Catherine Whitmore."

Twenty minutes later, Monaco police swarm the harbor like angry wasps. Dmitri's yacht becomes the center of a very expensive light show.

Sophia and I watch from a café across the street. Cappuccinos and front-row seats to justice.

"Think they'll find her?" Sophia asks.

"Probably. Dmitri's too panicked to cover his tracks properly."

Sure enough, we see them bring Lady Whitmore up from below deck. Blanket around her shoulders. Alive.

Dmitri comes up in handcuffs. The Bear looks smaller now. Scared.

"So," Sophia says. "No Monet. No twenty million. No yacht party."

"Nope."

"But we just saved someone's life."

"Yep."

She sips her cappuccino. "Not exactly what I signed up for."

"Me neither."

We watch the police boats motor away. Dmitri's empire crumbling in their wake.

"Next job," Sophia says, "let's stick to regular criminals. Less complicated."

I can't argue with that logic.
